title.native: 映画ヒーリングっど♥プリキュア ゆめのまちでキュン! っとGoGo! 大変身!!
title.romaji: Healin' Good♥Precure: Yume no Machi de Kyun! Tto GoGo! Dai Henshin!!

description:
The members of Healin' Good arrive in the city of Tokyo. In Tokyo, the "YumeR" experience that can project the people's inner dreams with the "dream pendant" that Nodoka and her friends wear has become very popular. Nodoka meets the princess of YumeR with magical power, Kaguya, at the dream town where everyone's dreams are overflowing. Then, mysterious enemies who are after everyone's dreams appear...! Can the Healin' Good and 5GoGo! teams protect everyone's dreams?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: 映画ヒーリングっど♥プリキュア

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

A Japanese composer, arranger and keyboard player. She graduated from the Kunitachi College of Music.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1636957081701093377)

Ryouta Nakamura is a director affiliated with Toei Animation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東堂いづみ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Todo)

Izumi Toudou is a collective pseudonym for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s staff.

[Official Website](https://machi.co/) | [Official Blog](https://ameblo.jp/miumachi10/) | [Profile (Horipro)](http://www.horipro-international.com/artist/machico) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MachicoOfficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/machico_3s25/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machico_(singer)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machico)

Machiko Saitou, better known by her stage name Machico, is a Japanese singer and voice actress from Hiroshima Prefecture who is currently affiliated with the Horipro talent agency. 

After participating in an audition organized by Horipro, she made her music debut in 2012, singing a theme song for a PC game. She was cast as the character Tsubasa Ibuki in the mobile game The Idolmaster: Million Live! in 2013. Apart from voice acting, she has performed theme songs for KonoSuba and Age 12. Machico released two albums between 2014 and 2015, and opened her official fanclub in late 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name.native: ホーバル・シェゲスタ・ダーレ

node.description:
[Website](https://habarudo.wordpress.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Habarudo) | [Tumblr](https://habarudo.tumblr.com/) | [DeviantArt](https://www.deviantart.com/habarudo) | [Vimeo](https://vimeo.com/habarudo) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/user/show/288)

Norwegian animator working for [Bug Films](https://anilist.co/studio/7348/BUG-FILMS) since November 2022. Previously worked for [Juumonji](https://anilist.co/studio/6219/Juumonji) between April 2019 to October 2022.

Some of his favorite animators include [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/Hiroyuki-Okiura), [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/Shingo-Yamashita), [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/Toshiyuki-Inoue), [Mitsuo Iso](https://anilist.co/staff/100151/Mitsuo-Iso) and [Yutaka Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101801/Yutaka-Nakamura).

Graduated from Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences with a Bachelor in Visual Arts and Design in 2016.
